intro: Pentacalia mikanioides, commonly known as the creeping pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and its flowers are usually pale blue to white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
